intro: Glaucium persicum, commonly known as Persian poppy, is a flowering plant native to the regions of Iran and Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Fumaria. Glaucium persicum typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
